alert.note: Alert for Columbiana; Jefferson (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 19 at 8:13PM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN JEFFERSON...EASTERN COLUMBIANA...BEAVER...VENANGO...BUTLER...ALLEGHENY...SOUTHWESTERN JEFFERSON...NORTHWESTERN GREENE...ARMSTRONG...CLARION...NORTHWESTERN FAYETTE...WESTERN FOREST...MERCER...WASHINGTON...LAWRENCE...CENTRAL INDIANA...WESTMORELAND...OHIO...MARSHALL...BROOKE AND HANCOCK COUNTIES THROUGH 900 PM EST... At 812 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Adamsville to near Meridian to near Mars to near Brownsville. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Power outages are possible with this line. Locations impacted include... Pittsburgh, Penn Hills, Mount Lebanon, Bethel Park, Ross Township, McCandless Township, Monroeville, Cranberry, Moon Township, New Castle, McMurray, and Greensburg. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in West Virginia between mile markers 9 and 14. Interstate 70 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 57. Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 1 and 80. Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 24 and 138. Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 71. Parkway North between mile markers 1 and 13. Interstate 376 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 84. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
